definition: to miss an appointment
to lose/to miss/to fail
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: But another no-show was perhaps more important.
sentences.chinese: 但是，另一個失約者也許更爲重要。

sentences.english: I hope you weren't too upset at my missing our meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你沒因爲我的失約而太生氣。

sentences.english: After waiting for two hours, John began to realize that Helen had stood him up.
sentences.chinese: 等了兩個小時以後，約翰開始意識到海倫失約了。

sentences.english: I can't believe that you stood me up.
sentences.chinese: 我簡直不敢相信你居然失約。

sentences.english: You'd better not break your appointment.
He went, but missed many appointments; she refused.
sentences.chinese: 孩子來過，但失約了很多次，他母親則從未露面。

sentences.english: I apologized to him for having broken my promise.
sentences.chinese: 我因失約而向他表歉意。

sentences.english: Jim said he'd be at the station, but he stood me up.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆說他要去車站的，但他失約了。

sentences.english: You must stand me up on purpose.
